summary: This is an email from a Deputy Chief in the White Plains Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a request from defense counsel in the Tartaglione case to review attorney visit logs and count slips. The email discusses a protective order and the process for a firewall counsel to review the documents before potential production.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Defendant in a case where defense counsel has requested attorney visit logs and count slips bearing his name.

persons.name: Judge Karas
persons.context: Judge who issued a protective order that may need modification to allow a firewall counsel to receive requested documents.

connections.description: Judge Karas appears to be presiding over a case involving Tartaglione, as he issued a protective order relevant to the case.

events.title: Request for Attorney Visit Logs and Count Slips
events.description: Defense counsel in the Tartaglione case requests to see attorney visit logs and count slips with Tartaglione's name on them, prompting internal DOJ correspondence about a protective order.

locations: 300 Quarropas Street, White Plains, New York 10601
keyFacts: Defense counsel for Tartaglione requested attorney visit logs and count slips related to their client.
A protective order exists that may restrict access to these documents, requiring review by a firewall counsel.
The firewall counsel may need Judge Karas to modify the protective order before receiving the documents.
The correspondence is from a Deputy Chief in the White Plains Division of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY.
The email indicates a procedural step to prevent certain attorneys from viewing the potentially sensitive documents.
